original_theorem: Let $X_1, \dots, X_n$ be a sequence of pairwise uncorrelated random variables. Suppose each variable has the same mean $E[X_i] = \mu$ and the same finite variance $Var(X_i) = \sigma^2$. Let the sample mean be defined as $\bar{X}_n = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^n X_i$. Then, the expectation of the sample mean is $E[\bar{X}_n] = \mu$, its variance is $Var(\bar{X}_n) = \frac{\sigma^2}{n}$, and for any $\epsilon > 0$, the probability of deviation from the mean is bounded by $P(|\bar{X}_n - \mu| \ge \epsilon) \le \frac{\sigma^2}{n\epsilon^2}$.
theorem_translation:
```lean4
theorem theorem_of_sample_mean_properties {Ω : Type*} [MeasureSpace Ω]
  {X : ℕ → Ω → ℝ} {n : ℕ} (hn : n > 0)
  (h_X_measurable : ∀ i, i < n → Measurable (X i))
  (h_pairwise_uncorrelated : ∀ i j, i < n → j < n → i ≠ j → MeasureTheory.cov (X i) (X j) volume = 0)
  (μ σ : ℝ) (hσ_nonneg : σ ≥ 0)
  (h_mean_eq : ∀ i, i < n → MeasureTheory.Integrable (X i) volume ∧ MeasureTheory.integral volume (X i) = μ)
  (h_variance_eq : ∀ i, i < n → MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x ↦ ((X i) x - μ)^2) volume ∧ (MeasureTheory.integral volume (fun ω ↦ (X i ω - μ)^2)) = σ^2) :
  let X_bar_n : Ω → ℝ := fun ω ↦ (1 / (n : ℝ)) * (∑ i in Finset.range n, X i ω)
  Measurable X_bar_n ∧
  MeasureTheory.Integrable X_bar_n volume ∧
  MeasureTheory.integral volume X_bar_n = μ ∧
  MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun ω ↦ (X_bar_n ω - μ)^2) volume ∧
  (MeasureTheory.integral volume (fun ω ↦ (X_bar_n ω - μ)^2)) = σ^2 / (n : ℝ) ∧
  ∀ ε : ℝ, ε > 0 → MeasureTheory.volume {ω | |X_bar_n ω - μ| ≥ ε} ≤ σ^2 / (n * ε^2) := by
```

  {X : ℕ → Ω → ℝ} {n : ℕ} (hn : n > 0)
  (i_dist_is_measurable : ∀ i, Measurable (X i))

  (h_mean_eq : ∀ i, i < n → Integrable (X i) ∧ snorm (X i) 2 volume < ⊤ ∧ ∫ ω, X i ω ∂volume = μ)
  (h_variance_eq : ∀ i, i < n → Integrable (fun x ↦ ((X i) x - μ)^2) ∧ snorm (X i - fun _ ↦ μ) 2 volume < ⊤ ∧ (∫ ω, ((X i) ω - μ)^2 ∂volume) = σ^2)
  (μ σ : ℝ) (hσ_finite : σ^2 < ⊤) :

  ∀ ε : ℝ, ε > 0 → MeasureTheory.measure (volume.restrict {ω | |X_bar_n ω - μ| ≥ ε}) Set.univ ≤ σ^2 / (n * ε^2) := by

  {X : ℕ → Ω → ℝ} {n : ℕ} (hn : n > 0)
  (h_X_measurable : ∀ i, i < n → Measurable (X i))
  (h_pairwise_uncorrelated : ∀ i j, i < n → j < n → i ≠ j → MeasureTheory.Cov (X i) (X j) = 0)
  (μ σ : ℝ) (hσ_nonneg : σ ≥ 0)
  (h_mean_eq : ∀ i, i < n → MeasureTheory.Integrable (X i) ∧ ∫ ω, X i ω ∂volume = μ)
  (h_variance_eq : ∀ i, i < n → MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x ↦ ((X i) x - μ)^2) ∧ (∫ ω, (X i ω - μ)^2 ∂volume) = σ^2) :
  let X_bar_n : Ω → ℝ := fun ω ↦ (1 / (n : ℝ)) * (∑ i in Finset.range n, X i ω)
  Measurable X_bar_n ∧
  MeasureTheory.Integrable X_bar_n ∧
  ∫ ω, X_bar_n ω ∂volume = μ ∧
  MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun ω ↦ (X_bar_n ω - μ)^2) ∧
  (∫ ω, (X_bar_n ω - μ)^2 ∂volume) = σ^2 / (n : ℝ) ∧
  ∀ ε : ℝ, ε > 0 → volume {ω | |X_bar_n ω - μ| ≥ ε} ≤ σ^2 / (n * ε^2) := by sorry
